section.heading: Minimum standards for members of the Metropolitan Police Department.

para.text: To be eligible for appointment as a sworn member of the Metropolitan Police Department, an applicant shall have either:
Successfully completed 60 hours of post-secondary education at an accredited college or university;

Served in the Armed Forces of the United States, including the Organized Reserves and National Guard, for at least 2 years on active duty and if separated from the military, have received an honorable discharge; or
Served at least 3 years in a full-duty status with a full-service police department in a municipality or state within the United States and have resigned or retired in good standing.

para.text: An applicant shall be ineligible for appointment as a sworn member of the Metropolitan Police Department if the applicant:
Was previously determined by a law enforcement agency to have committed serious misconduct, as determined by the Chief by General Order;
Was previously terminated or forced to resign for disciplinary reasons from any commissioned or recruit or probationary position with a law enforcement agency; or
Previously resigned from a law enforcement agency to avoid potential, proposed, or pending adverse disciplinary action or termination.
